title: 'The existential crisis is totally normal': Madison Keys on life after her first major title
description: In January, Madison Keys won her first Grand Slam title -- and everything changed. What she didn't expect? The struggle that followed.
author: D'Arcy Maine

title: Can Taylor Fritz win the Indian Wells title again?
description: Taylor Fritz was the surprise champion at Indian Wells in 2022. And after a massive 2024 season, he's a favorite to win a second time.
author: D'Arcy Maine

title: Unlock the Perfect Slice Serve - Essential Tennis Podcast #415
description: The wide slice serve is a CRITICAL tool to have in your tool box. It pulls opponents out of position, opens the court up for you to hit into, exposes their usually weaker backhand side, and forces them to run twice as far for the next shot - if they even get it at all. Letâ€™s take a deep dive into how YOU can develop this powerful weapon, step by step in this special episode of the Essential Tennis Podcast.
author: Essential Tennis LLC

title: 3 Djokovic Secrets To Winning More Matches - Essential Tennis Podcast #414
description: In this special episode of the Essential Tennis Podcast, you're going to learn the top 3 tactical secrets of Novak Djokovic that you can apply in your very next match. Use these tools to gain precision, consistency, and offense to make your opponents more uncomfortable, win more points, and win more matches.
author: Essential Tennis LLC

title: Dominant Swiatek reaches Indian Wells quarter-finals
description: Defending champion Iga Swiatek secures her place in the Indian Wells quarter-finals with a 6-1 6-1 thrashing of Karolina Muchova.

title: Draper solves Brooksby puzzle to reach Indian Wells fourth round
description: Jack Draper overcomes a slow start to beat Jenson Brooksby and reach the Indian Wells fourth round.

title: Watch: Was Rune's Indian Wells tweener like Federer's unforgettable shot?
description: Holger Rune hit a shot-of-the-tournament contender at a critical moment against Stefanos Tsitsipas on Tuesday at the BNP Paribas Open. Facing break point at 4-3 in the second set, he hit an incredible tweener to help dig out of trouble and eventually seal his 6-4, 6-4 victory. But how did it feel in the moment? "I think it felt better on the court, actually, but it also looked good on the phone, definitely," Rune said. "I had the expectation that I looked like Roger Federer when I hit it, and I didn't quite do that. So that was disappointing, you know. Definitely felt better." ARE YOU NOT ENTERTAINED?! ðŸ¤©ðŸ¤©ðŸ¤©@holgerrune2003 | @BNPPARIBASOPEN | #TennisParadise pic.twitter.com/vRGlOp8bNa â€” ATP Tour (@atptour) March 11, 2025 The Dane was smiling when he made the comment. One of Roger Federer's greatest shots was a tweener against Novak Djokovic at the US Open. The former No. 4 player in the PIF ATP Rankings clearly was simply happy with his performance against the in-form Tsitsipas, who recently won the Dubai title. "I think a lot of good things today," Rune said. "I think my tweener was not bad."Â  Watch the full clip of the hot shot above and decide for yourself! [NEWSLETTER FORM]

title: Rain suspends play again in Indian Wells
description: Rain has suspended play againÂ on Tuesday at the 2025 BNP Paribas Open in Indian Wells, where no action will take place before 5:30 p.m. local time. After rain delayed the start of Day 7 action, Tallon Griekspoor and Yosuke Watanuki did step onto Stadium 2 in the first ATP Tour singles match of the day. However, play was suspended at 1:27 p.m. local time with the Dutchman Griekspoor leading 7-6(4), 4-1. They resumed again at 2:00 p.m and Griekspoor quickly wrapped up a 7-6(4), 6-1 win to reach the quarter-finals at an ATP Masters 1000 for the first time. On Stadium 1, Holger Rune overcame Stefanos Tsitsipas in straight sets to improve to 4-0 in their Lexus ATP Head2Head series. The rain began again shortly after the conclusion of Rune's win at 4:05 p.m., when Arthur Fils and Marcos Giron were forced off court at 1-1 in the first set. There will be no play before 5:30 p.m. local time. Later on Tuesday, Daniil Medvedev will play Tommy Paul in the other fourth-round match. [NEWSLETTER FORM]

title: Indian Wells 2025 Day 6 Recap
description: The last sixteen lineup is complete at the 2025 BNP Paribas Open, and Carlos Alcaraz looks like a big odds-on favourite to capture his third straight title at the Tennis Gardens. The Spaniard brushed aside Denis Shapovalov in straight sets and will face Grigor Dimitrov for a place in the quarter-finals after he came through â€¦
author: Jonathan

title: Indian Wells 2025 Day 5 Recap
description: Sunday at Indian Wells saw the top half of the menâ€™s draw complete their third-round matches. Stefanos Tsitsipas had the performance of the day by dispatching Matteo Berrettini in straight sets to maintain his excellent form since Dubai. Daniil Medvedev is the highest-ranked player left in the top half, and he only had 30 minutes â€¦
